Your cell phone rings. (its your girlfriend)
You heat someone Knocking on the front door
1.content:
Well its finally official, you've graduated from High School, and you’re going off to college this fall, but right now you have got the whole summer ahead of you and after years of saving and planning you’re going to Europe.

For the next two glorious months you and your friends will be backpacking from country to country, taking in the sights, enjoying the food, and seeing where the road takes you.

Your friends will be here to pick you up any minute now, what could go wrong?
1.title: Who is it?

11.content:
You’re in your room packing when you hear your mom say, “Sweetheart, can you come down here for a second.”

As you walk down stairs you see her in the living room looking through your baby book. You walk over to her and she smiles pointing to a picture of you when you were a baby, “You were the most beautiful baby, look at that curly hair.” She says

You smile and she says, “You grew up so fast, but you know you’ll always be my baby.” She stands up and gives you a hug, “I love you mom.” You say.

As you turn to walk back up the stairs you hear your mom say, “Where are you going.”

“I’ve got to finish packing; my friends should be here any minute.” You say

“Well that’s kind of what I wanted to talk to you about.” She says, as you stop and turn around, “I don’t want you to go.” She says

“Mom it’s going to be okay, it’s only two months and then I’ll be back.” You say “No, I’m not ready for you to leave home period.” She says,

“Don’t worry, it’s not like I’m your only child.” You say, “I know but I’m not ready to let go of either of you, will you please stay?” she says

“Mom, I’ve been planning this trip for years, I’m going.” You say

You give her a hug and turn to walk back upstairs, you start to feel dizzy, and as the room starts to spin you feel yourself fall to the ground.

When the room stops spinning you find yourself on the floor, but something doesn’t feel right, your cloths are too big…
11.title: Your mom calls you

111.content:
You try to stand but you can't, you then look up to see your mom standing over you smiling.

She then reaches down and picks you up out of you cloths, still a little disoriented, you don’t know what’s going on, until you look over to see your mom holding you in the mirror. Chills go gown your spin as you realize that she turned you into a baby.

Still in shock you look at your mom, she has a big smile on her face, and from the look on yours she knows exactly what you are thinking.

But she just gives you a big hug and says, “Don’t give me that look, I didn’t want it to have to come to this, and I gave you the choice. But honestly I think i prefer it this way, now I have my baby boy back."
111.title: You're a Baby

1111.content:
As you look at yourself in your mother’s arms, you finally manage to say, "What! Are you crazy?!”

But your mom just smiles and says, "You’re so cute." as she pinches your little cheeks.

Suddenly, there’s a knock at the door, "I wonder who that could be." she says with a smile.

She then sits you down on the couch, as she walked away to answer the door you realized who it had to be, it was your friends coming to pick you up. The door opens and you cringe in terror as you hear your mother say, "I’m sorry boys, we had a family emergency, have fun in Europe." as she closes the door.

She walks back into the room; you are frozen in horror at the thought of your current situation. You’re trapped in the body that can’t stand up, you’re not going to Europe, and your mom has clearly gone off the deep end.

“Mom, what did you do?” You say, “Well you can’t go anywhere like this so I told your friends you couldn’t make it.” She says smiling as she picks you up.

“No, you can’t do this to me, I’m 19.” You say, but she just smiles and says, “Oh sweetie, you’re not even one yet.” You then look down at your little body, remembering that you couldn't even stand up by yourself.

She then holds you in one arm while picking your clothes up off the floor, and walks into the kitchen, “Well we won’t need these anymore.” She says as she throws them into the trash.

“What do you mean, change me back!” you demand, but she just smiles, “Uh oh, looks like someone is cranky.” She says, “But don’t worry mommy is here.” She says
1111.title: You Can Talk

11112.content:
Mom holds you up to her chest and you ask, “What are you doing?”

Mom grins, “You are getting cranky! Trust me, this will make you feel better!”

Mom unclasps her bra and your eyes get wide as she places your mouth over her nipple. You instinctively start to suck and get a few drops of milk. As you tasted Mom’s milk, you realize how good it feels. Mom was right, it started to make you feel better. After a few minutes of feeding, Mom pulls you away and asks, “There you go! That’s better isn’t it?”

You look up and nod. Now that you aren’t cranky, you crack a giggle, “Ok, so what’s the big idea turning me into a kid again? I was looking forward to backpacking through Europe!”

“You will have plenty of time to do that later. I wasn’t quite ready to let you go, so this was the only way to get your attention.”

Mom props you up on the bed and you watch as she puts a diaper on you. You joke, “So instead of having a self-sufficient teenaged son, you would rather have me back in diapers?”

Mom nods her head, “This way, I have more control over my sweet little baby!”

“How long are you planning on keeping me like this?”

Mom answered, “Hmmm…I’m not sure. Maybe a few days, maybe a few weeks.” Mom grinned as she sarcastically said, “Maybe you can grow up again! You know? Have a fresh start?”

Your eyes get wide. You know when Mom gets an idea she sticks to it. You try getting out of the situation and say, “What about clothes and supplies? You will spend a fortune outfitting another baby. You sold all of mine and Lilly’s baby stuff at a garage sale years ago.”

Mom thought for a second and says, “Hmm…I forgot about that small detail.” Mom thought more and realized, “Aha! If I remember right, I didn’t sell ALL of your clothes!” Mom ran upstairs to the attic and came back down with a box. Mom was happy, “We forgot to put this box out during the garage sale! I’m sure we can find something in here to fit you now!”

Mom opens the box and sees that the clothes are………
11112.title: Feed you

111121.content:
Mom cracks a grin as she begins looking through the box of clothes, “It looks like this box was Lilly’s old stuff! It’s a bit out of style, but they will atleast fit you for now!”

Mom pulls out a babydoll dress and begins to pull it over your head, “Mom? What are you doing? Those are girls clothes?”

Mom explained, “I know, but there is nothing else in here but Lil’s old stuff. This will have to do until we go shopping.”

2 minutes later, you are wearing Lilly’s old dress and Mom pulls tights up your legs. You crawl over to the mirror and sit in front of it. You look ridiculous as a baby boy wearing a girl’s outfit. It’s bad enough that mom turned you into a baby, but now you are a crossdressing baby. You tell Mom, “This is ridiculous Mom! I can’t leave the house as a baby boy wearing this girly stuff!”

Mom nods, “You are right. Until we find you some proper clothes for a boy, you are going to need some adjustments…”

“Uh oh…” You think as you feel your body change again. Your hair grows out and you look in the mirror. Instead of a baby boy, you are now a baby girl. You look a lot like Lilly did back then.”

“Mom! What did you do to me?”

Mom starts putting a rubber band in your hair to keep it out of your face, “You were right sweetie! I can’t take you in public to go shopping as a boy wearing a dress. This way, we wont get any strange looks from people.” Mom is happy with her magical power and grins, “Don’t worry sweetie! You look adorable! As long as you don’t talk with your normal adult sentences, nobody will notice anything!”

You sarcastically reply, “Oh great? So now you want me to babble like a baby too?”

Mom nods as she says, “Of course! We can’t risk somebody hearing a baby using adult words. If you don’t agree to act your new part, I can always make some more adjustments to your body!”

You cross your arms and sarcastically say, “Whatever Mom! What ELSE could you possibly do to make this worse Mom? Instead of being a 19 year old teenager, I’m a baby girl!”

Mom giggles as she uses her magical powers again. You don’t feel any different this time. You wonder what she did to you. Mom has a big grin on her face as you try to ask her what happened. Instead of words, all you can manage to do is babble gibberish. You try again to talk and just babble more sounds. “Oh crap! I can’t talk anymore!” You think as Mom laughs, “So much for being able to sass me now!”

Mom picks you up and explains, “I’ll think about giving you the ability to talk once we are back from the store. Until then, it will be easier for you to act your part as a baby if you can’t talk!”

111121112.title: 3 months?

1111212.content:
As Mom carries you towards the door, your father comes inside. He sees Mom holding a baby and giggles, “So you decided to use your magic on Nathan huh? I figured you would come up with something to keep him around longer!” Mom nods her head in agreement as Dad comes up to examine your new body.

As Dad gets closer, he recognizes you wearing one of Lilly’s old dresses. Dad’s eyes get wide, “Whoa? You turned him into a girl?”

Mom explained, “At first I turned him into a baby boy. But we didn’t have any clothes for a boy so I had to improvise.”

Dad squeezed your cheek, “I know this was quite a drastic way to find out about your mother’s magic powers….but given the circumstances, how are you doing little buddy?” Dad quickly corrected himself. It felt strange to call a baby girl ‘buddy.’ Dad smirked, “…I meant….How are you doing princess?” You remember how Dad always called Lilly princess when she was young.

You try to tell Dad something but all that comes out is baby babble. Dad laughs and looks at Mom, “I see you went all the way with your magic. He can’t talk can he?”

Mom nods, “You mean SHE can’t talk. And yes, I went all the way with it. Nathan was talking too much and it would cause weird looks at the store. It will be easier to shop without his ability to talk.” Mom thought for a moment and then explained, “While Nathan is like this…We should call him Natalie. That’s more appropriate for his current body.” Mom then asked Dad, “Are you coming along to shop for new clothes?”

Dad sarcastically replied, “I wish I could…But know how much MEN hate to shop!” Dad winked as he emphasized ‘men.’

Mom giggled at Dad’s reply. Mom knew what Dad was alluding to. Mom knew how much Dad secretly enjoyed when she would use her magic to turn him into a woman. Mom smirked at Dad’s pathetic attempt to be turned into a female for the shopping trip.

Mom agreed, “Okay. I could use the help….If that’s what it takes for you to come along..” Mom then asked Dad, “So…what were you thinking? The usual?” (Mom was referring to the 37 year old female body she usually turned Dad into so they could go out as friends.) Mom then looked at you and giggled, “Or…Maybe Natalie could use an older sister to tag along?”

Dad decides to choose…………
1111212.title: Somebody comes over first

11112122.content:
Dad thought about it for a moment and laughed, “I’ve never been a younger girl before! That might be fun!” Dad squeezed your cheeks again and giggled, “Do you want an older sister Natalie?”

Once again, you try to answer Dad, but only baby gibberish comes out. Dad laughs, “I’ll take that as a yes!” Dad then tells Mom, “Okay! Turn me into his older sister!”

Mom agrees. Before she uses her magic, she asks, “Hmm…How much older were you thinking? If I made you 4 or 5 you would be old enough to talk and could help me choose things for Natalie. On the other hand, if you were 9 or 10, you would be old enough to carry things and help push the cart around….”

Dad thinks about it and decides to turn into a………….
11112122.title: Older sister

111121221.content:
5 minutes later, Dad stood in the mirror and swished his dress back and forth. He giggled, “This is incredible Sara! I’m totally adorable!” Dad pointed to his hair and smiled, “These pigtails are perfect! I can’t believe I’m only 5 years old! I unexpectedly have so much energy! I don’t know why we didn’t think of doing this before! After we are done shopping, you should take me and ‘Natalie’ to the park. It would be a superb experience! I have an adequate body now to relive some childhood memories!” Looking up at Mom, Dad asked, “Wouldn’t that be fun Sara?”

Mom couldn’t help but laugh after hearing Dad talk with his normal vocabulary in a 5 year olds body. Mom waved her magic finger and said, “Sorry honey, but girls your age don’t talk like that. I can’t risk any unwanted attention in public.”

Dad knew Mom used her magic again. He looked in the mirror and spun his dress around again, “Dis dwess is so pwetty!” Dad immediately realized that Mom used her magic to change his speech. Hearing his childish slurs, Dad laughed even harder, “Dis so funny! I sound like widdle girl now!”

Mom nodded, “Just like baby Natalie…I can’t have you running around in public using your normal vocabulary. I made some adjustments with my magical powers so you sound like the body you are in.”

Dad giggled in his new voice, “Dat was gooood tinkin! Don’t worry Sara….I won’t get any stwange looks tawking like dis!”

Mom corrected him, “And one more thing….You can’t call me Sara while you are a 5 year old girl. You are going to have to call me Mommy.”

Dad laughed and nodded, “Okay Mommy!”

Mom thought for a second and said, “Speaking of names….You are going to need a new one too. How about Christie? I’ve always liked that name!”

Dad nodded, “Okay. Cwistie it is!”

Mom smiled, “Come on Christie! Let’s get in the car! We need to go shopping for your baby sister, Natalie!”
111121221.title: 4 or 5 year old

1111212211.content:
30 minutes later, Mom carried you into a clothing store for kids. You were still surprised that Dad chose to tag along on the shopping trip as ‘Christie.’ Before today, you would have never imagined your manly father ever masquerading around as a woman. More less a 5 year old girl. Dad didn’t even seemed phased by the changes. He walked along side Mom as they made their way into the baby boy’s section. You were glad that Mom was true to her word and was going to find you some clothes for a boy.

After paying for the new outfits, Mom brought you into the woman’s bathroom and used the changing table. While she changed you diaper, she made sure nobody else was in the bathroom and temporarily gave your speaking ability back. Mom told you, “You can talk again sweetie. How are you holding up?”

Lying on your back, you looked up at Mom, “I’m ok I guess.” Dad stands on his tip toes and talks to you too, “Whadda you tink? Isn’t it a kick being a kid?”

You roll your eyes at Dad, “Maybe for you! You’ve been able to walk and talk all day!” Looking back up at Mom you ask, “Now that we have all these boys’ clothes, can you use your magic to turn me into a boy again?”

Mom shook her head and whispered, “There are too many cameras at the mall. I can’t risk somebody noticing I came in here with a baby girl and left with a baby boy. We will wait until we are home to change you back!” You tried to complain but another woman walked inside the ladies room and Mom quickly used her magic to reduce your speech to baby gibberish again. Mom sticks a pacifier in your mouth to quiet you down.

As the 3 of you walk out of the mall, a pushy saleswoman from a ___________store gets Mom’s attention.
1111212211.title: Shopping

choices: During the week, Mom turns Dad into Christine again
Mom lines up a playdate so Christine can wear her new dress
11112122111.content:
On the way out the mall, Mom pushes you in a stroller. You admit to yourself that the free ride is much more relaxing than walking. As you suck on the pacifier, you accidentally spit it out and it falls on your dress just out of your reach. You try to tell Mom to grab it for you but all that comes out is baby babble. You hadn’t realized she used her magic to take away your ability to speak again.

As you pass a costume store, your mother jokes, “Halloween is only a week away. Do you girls want to pick something out wear trick-or-treating?” Your father gets excited and runs ahead. Your mother whispers down to you laughing, “Whoa. I was just kidding. I didn’t think Christie would be so excited.” You babble something but she had no idea what you are saying. There is a rack of costumes from the Disney movie Frozen in the front. Dad grabs an Elsa dress and holds it up to his body, “It’s my size! Can I get it? Pwease pwease pwease? Pwetty pwease with cherwies on top?” Dad holds the cutest smile he can manage with his 5 year old Christie face.

Mom snickers at the idea of her husband buying a princess dress, “Sure. As long as you pick out your little sister one too!” Christie grabs a tiny Anna dress and holds it up to your body in the stroller, “This one will fit her perfectly! We can go as Anna and Elsa!” You glare at your father trying to tell him you don’t share the same excitement of getting dressed up as a girl for Halloween. Mom promised she would turn you back into a boy when you got home. The last thing you wanted to do was to collect more supplies so Mom would be tempted to use her magic again and make you a baby girl.

Mom grabbed both the dresses and had sticker shock, “OMG! Costumes have gotten expensive over the years. These are 50 dollars each! That seems silly to spend that much on a dress you will both wear once.” Dad gave a pouty face, “Pwease Mommy? I pwomise I’ll wear it more din once. It comes with a cute tiawwa and sparkly shoes too. It wooks so fun ta wear. Pwease pwease pwease?”

Mom laughs, “As hard as it is to deny an adorable face like that…NO. I’m not spending all that money on costumes you’ll regret later. You do realize if I buy you this expensive dress that you’ll have to become Christine many more times to make it worthwhile. Halloween is next weekend. When were you planning on becoming a little girl again?” Mom waved her hand and gave Dad his ability to speak with his normal vocabulary so they could communicate easier.

You father explains, “That’s easy. Just turn me into Christine a few times during the week after work. I could use the practice at bring the older sister anyways for our big trick-or-treat outing. Then after Halloween, I’m sure we can find a little girl’s birthday party or some other proper occasion so I can wear the dress a few more times.”

Mom was surprised, “I didn’t regress your brain at all. You realize all these thoughts are your right? To be clear…You are requesting to become a little girl a handful of times after this? I assumed this was a one-time thing for the shopping spree?”

Dad giggled while twirling in his dress, “You know I always love masquerading around in a female body.”

Mom smirked, “I know. But normally you become an adult woman so you can have boobs and we can hang out as girlfriends. This is certainly new for you to become a little girl and pretend to be my daughter.”

“I think it’s fun! What’s the big deal? I don’t have much going on this week after work anyways. It’s not like it’s permanent. You can use your magic whenever you want to turn me into your husband again. Plus, baby Nathan/Natalie could use an older sister around now and then.”

Mom laughed, “Okay. If that’s what you want, we need to stop by another store on our way out of the mall. Christie is going to need a few more supplies. I’ll grab a 5 pack of panties for you, some tights for under your Elsa dress, some hair accessories….I’ll also get you a kids toothbrush and a few nightgowns in case you want to sleep like that.”

Dad nodded, “Thanks!” He then remembered something, “Just DON”T turn me into Christie on Wednesday evening. There’s a big game on. It won’t be as exciting to watch as a 5 year old.”

Mom agreed and then looked at you with a revelation, “Hmmm…That means I’ll need to pick up some more baby girl supplies for Nathan too. All I bought today was baby boy clothes. He will be spending more time as baby Natalie if you two want to go trick-or-treating as sisters.” Your eyes get wide hearing Mom’s plan. You are angry with your father for wanting to do this. His fun and games will force you to be a baby girl a few more times after this. It was bad enough your Mom turned you into a baby again. Now you are going to have to switch back and forth into a baby girl occasionally.
11112122111.title: Haloween Store

11112122112.content:
The pushy saleswoman sayss, “We have really cute jewelry for you and your daughters inside!” She points to the 5 year old girl (Dad) and says, “She has such a cute dress…!” Dad likes the attention and gives the saleswoman a big smile back. She continues,”…Don’t you want new earrings for her?…..” The saleswoman makes a strange face and notices, “Oh…She doesn’t have pierced ears yet? That’s such a shame! I’ve never seen a girl your age without earrings?”

Dad’s smile went away and he suddenly felt embarrassed for not having pierced ears. The pushy saleswoman kept going, “Don’t worry! We have a special going on! She will get 3 sets of earrings free if she gets her ears pierced!”

Mom replied, “No thanks…we were just leaving…..”

Dad interrupted and pulled on Mom’s leg, “Wait Mommy! I wanna get eawings!” Mom was surprised with how much Dad seemed to want the earrings. Mom whispered with a laugh, “Why do you want earrings so bad?”

Dad whispers back, “Cuz all the other girls have them! I feel dumb cuz I don’t have pierced ears!”

Mom whispered back again laughing, “Do I have to remind you that you aren’t really a girl? Why would you care what the other’s think? Plus, it hurts to get your ears pierced! After we get home, I’m going to turn you back into your male body anyways?”

Dad nodded, “I know. But you said you were taking us to the park after this. I just want to fit in with the other girls! Pweeaasse Mommy!” Dad begs in the best cutesy voice he can manage.

Mom smirks. She knows it’s pointless trying to argue with a 5 year old. Mom finally agrees and tells the woman, “Okay! You can pierce Christie’s ears!”
11112122112.title: Jewelry Store

111121221121.content:
On their way home from the mall, Christie wanted to have some more fun before turning back into a grown man. For the next hour, Christie ran around the playground while Mom sat with

Finally back home, they all were in the living room and Mom told Christie, “I’m glad you had fun today. But I’m going to need my husband around this afternoon to help with the baby!”

Christie nodded, “Okay. I’m ready to turn back.”

Mom told Christie, “Take off your dress so it doesn’t rip when you grow back into a man!”

Christie slid the dress off and Mom pointed her magic finger. After a few moments, Christie asked, “What’s wrong? Why aren’t I changing?”

Mom was surprised, “I’m not sure? This has never happened before?” Mom tried her magic a few more times but nothing happened. Christie crossed her arms, “You aren’t joking with me are you?”

Mom shook her head, “No! I’m serious! My magic isn’t working on you for some reason?” To test her magic, she pointed her finger to you and turned you into a baby boy. You smiled at finally becoming a boy. Mom also gave your speech back and you said, “Thanks Mom!” You were still wearing the pink baby dress and asked, “How about some pants?”

Mom replied, “Just a minute. I need to see if my magic works on Christie.” Mom then tried changing Christie again but nothing happened. Christie got nervous, “I’m not stuck like this am I? This was fun for a day, but I can’t be stuck as a 5 year old girl! What about my job?...” Mom interrupted, “Relax! There must be an explanation. Put your dress back on until we figure this out. My magic seems to be working fine except with you?”

Mom grabbed her phone and started making a call. She told Christie, “Keep an eye on the baby for a minute!” You feel ridiculous as a baby boy wearing girl’s clothes and tell Mom, “What about my clothes?” Mom doesn’t have time to deal with changing your clothes and decides to turn you back into a baby girl. You complain, “Hey! I thought you were going to……..” Just then, you lost your ability to speak again. Only baby babble came out. Mom started talking on her cell phone while you squirmed around on the floor.

1111212211212.title: Mom tries some more magic

11112122112122.content:
Mom’s eyes got wide, “Of course! Why didn’t I think of that??” Mom looks at Dad (Currently in the body of a 5 year old girl they were calling ‘Christie’) and makes a sarcastic grin, “You just HAD to get your ears pierced, didn’t you?!”

Christie stands up and straightens her dress. Relived to find out it was only the earrings causing Mom’s magic not to work, she sticks his tongue out and jokes, “So what? They look cute! I didn’t know it would cause your magic to fail. I will just take them out and you can turn me back to a guy again.” Christie takes her earrings out and looks up at Mom, “Okay. Use your magic to turn me back!”

Mom concentrates for a few moments. Nothing happens. Dad looks up and asks, “What’s going on? Why isn’t your magic working? I took the earrings out!”

Mom leans in close to Christie and looks at her earlobes. Mom shakes her head, “Natalie was right. My magic isn’t working because you are no longer the little girl I turned you into earlier. You still have holes in your ears. Until the holes close back, my magic is useless.”

Christie sighs and crosses her arms, “How long is that going to take? A few hours?”

Mom shakes her head, “More like a few days. Maybe even a week..”

Christie stomps her foot, “A week! I can’t be stuck as a 5 year old girl for a week! I have to work tomorrow!”

Mom cracks a smile at seeing Christie cause a tantrum. Mom thinks for a moment and has an idea. She looks at Baby Natalie and says, “Looks like it’s your lucky day!” Mom uses her magic and Baby Natalie grows taller and taller. She turns into a man and suddenly is a copy of Dad’s normal body. The former teenaged boy…turned baby girl….turned grown man..lets out a smile, “Woo Hoo! I’m a guy again!”

Mom nods, “You will have to go to work for your father until ‘Christie’s’ ears heal up.

Mom bends down to Christie and giggles, “Just think of this as a vacation! There is nothing we can do until your ears heal.”

Christie’s frown turned into a grin, “You are right! I could use a vacation!” Spinning around and causing her dress to twirl, Christie laughed, “I didn’t imagine my next vacation would be in a body like this, but having no responsibilities will be relaxing!”

Mom smiles, “That reminds me…We are going to need some more outfits for you. That was the only dress we have that fits your body. Let’s go back to the store for some more supplies!”

Christie jokes, “This time I’m sticking to clip-on earrings!”
11112122112122.title: Uses magic to reverse the piercing

111121221121221.content:
You are glad to be a man again. Even if it’s in your father’s body. You will have to go to work as him because Dad is stuck as a 5 year old they are calling ‘Christie.’ When Mom and Christie get home from shopping, Christie seems happy that she has a few new outfits to wear until the holes in her ears heal. Until her ears heal, Mom can’t use her magic to turn him back to normal. 143.content:
As you open the door, you see your best friend Allison sitting there, giving you full blown puppy dog eyes and pouty lip, begging, "Please don’t go... What will I do this summer?"

"We’ve been through this, Ally. You'll be fine. I'll video chat with you every night." You tell her

If you're wondering why Allison was acting the way she was, it was she was a very awkward girl, nerdy if you will. She once confided that before you, she never had any friends, and always felt uncomfortable around other people. When she heard about my trip to Europe, she dreaded it deeply fearing the change of our routine, the idea of being around my other friends, and then the idea of possibly being alone by staying here, as you were one of the few people she trusted to be herself around; a grade-A over-9000 otaku. However, you had a chat with her and her parents, and you thought she understood... But in a way, you don't blame her. You've never been so far apart from her for more than a couple of days since you met, and her psyche has still so much to process. She never did click with your other friends, and they the same, but that really isn't her fault though...

A bit teary-eyed, she said, "Okay." She hugged me tight, and I mean really tight.

"I'll see you when I land, and I promise, I'll be back in August..."

"Why...? I want to stay with you though!!" she blurted, as a sharp pain went into your back. Before you can react, everything went black.

As you groggily awoke, you knew something didn't feel right, as you looked around, noticing you weren't in your house anymore. It sort of looked like the attic of the house where Allison lived with her mom. As you opened your eyes, she leaned over you, holding your laptop, pushing a button, allowing a recorded audio chat to play.

"Are you going to bring the little baby?" one voice said.

"Ally isn't a baby... but no, she isn't coming." you said.

"My god, I can't stand her, always staring silently, then talking on and on about things NO ONE CARES ABOUT!!" a girl says.

"Tammy, for the last time, she is just shy and trying to make new friends." you defended again.

"I get where you're coming from, I don't really have any problem with her, but she can grate your nerves from time to time. How do you deal with it?" a different guy's voice says.

"I've known her since kindergarten, well before you guys. She isn't as bad as you make her out to be, if you actually are willing to get to know her more."

"'Well, I can hang out with her for three hours, but I don't think I could do three months,' is what I guess what they're saying." the second male voice utters.

"Well I think this will do her some good." says the first male voice. "She's always clinging to you."

"Ughhh..." you groan, dejected. "I know, but I still feel bad about leaving her behind. If I had the money for the ticket, I buy her one..."

"God... Just do her..." Tammy says.

"Why do I hang out with you, Tammy?" you ask.

Allison closes the laptop. "I knew your 'other friends' never liked me, and this trip was their way of trying to steal you away from me... So I changed your plans...” she says.

You try to tell her, "No, you can't do this." However, you swear your voice doesn't sound right. Maybe you're still groggy...

Allison suddenly screams out in terror, "NO!! YOU CAN'T GO!! I DON'T KNOW WHAT I'D DO WITH MYSELF!!" Calming down a little, but her voice still wobbling with fear, her terror then turns to a strange disturbing happiness. "We're going to have the bestest summer vacation ever..." The look in her eyes and the smile on her face made you worry. Had the idea of you leaving put her psyche under so much stress she snapped and now has you captive in her house?

As you try to get up, she shakes her index finger back and forth, telling you, "You haven't seen the best part, Heath (that's your name). Look in the mirror." She rolls a large mirror before you, and you tremble at your reflection, seeing...

14422.content:
Before you realize it the time to leave has arrived, and suddenly everything is a blur of activity. The cab to the airport. The standing in line to check in. The wait to pass through security. Long periods of waiting in the departure lounge before you finally board your plane. The rush to get to your seat, where you sit as the plane waits on the tarmac, a variety of assorted noises coming from under the cabin floor as the ground crew did who knows what down there with the luggage. You wouldn’t have thought of yourself as a nervous flyer, although you’d only been on one flight before ,back when you were six and the family had spent three weeks with your Uncle James out in Boulder, right before the cancer took him. Before your thoughts could travel too far along that maudlin road the captain came on the intercom, speaking in the calm practiced pilots voice they all have, apologizing for the delay and giving a rundown of the flight information, which you half listened to then promptly forgot as the cabin crew went through their little safety procedure demo. At long last the plane was pushed out of the terminal and started it’s rumbling trudge down the taxiways towards the take-off point. This journey too seemed to take forever, and at one point Billy, ever the joker, commented that it looked like you must have gotten on a bus by mistake, and maybe they were planning on driving all the way to Europe.
For a while it seemed as if you would never get off the ground. Then the pitch of the engines wound up, the whining drone became a roar, and you were pushed back into your seat. The rumbling and shaking of the plane grew more intense until it suddenly died away completely. You were off the ground and headed into the great blue yonder.
The next several hours were a mix of heady excitement and tedious boredom.
You chatted excitedly with your friends, fidgeted. Read the in-flight magazine. The small screen in the head rest in front of you was playing an assortment of movies, all of which you had seen before and were not to interested in watching again. You dug out the copy of your favorite book, and generally tried to pass the time. A passage in the book reminded you of the mysterious letter, nestled in your luggage stowed in the belly of the plane somewhere below you. When you mentioned it to your friends you all managed to kill a good half hour speculating who sent it and what it could possibly say, before growing board with the topic and turning back to flipping idly through the in-flight entertainment channels to pass the time.
At long last, groggy from too little sleep yet still riding the crest of excitement, you found yourself standing in the baggage claim watching for your luggage to show up.
After a while you start to worry. It’s been several minutes and none of your distinctively coloured back packs have shown up.

Chapter?

You couldn’t believe it. All the other luggage had been claimed, and yours still hadn’t shown up. You wait until the belt stops moving before admitting it. Somehow, they had lost your luggage. Not only yours, but that of your friends as well. So much for that easily identifiable distinctive pattern you had picked out.

Resigned, you make your way to the airline’s lost luggage counter to see what they could do.

The guy behind the desk was typically British. Accent. Polished., The whole nine yards. You tell him what has happened.
He types a few words into his terminal.
“I’m sorry sir” he says, typing a bit more and shaking his head, “No reports of lost luggage so far. If you’ll describe them to me I’ll enter it into our database and let you know if anything shows up”
He turned back to the screen, calling up a claim form. After getting the main details, name, where you are staying, contact number, flight information, he asks you to describe the missing bags.
“Um, okay”, you say, “There were three of them, all identical. Back packs for hiking, you know. We’re planning of seeing Europe, hitch hiking our way across. So our luggage is really back packs with all our clothes and hiking gear in them.”
“Any distinctive markings”?. "Oh yeah", you add "Red and Blue stripes, and a white eagle logo".
"For America"! Billy chimed in, unnecessarily.
"Are they from American Eagle Outfitters, then"?
"No", you reply "We bought them at a sporting goods store. They’re soccer bags".
"Soccer bags… wait. Crystal Palace Football Club bags? "
“Yeah, that’s it”, said John, “but not football, soccer”.
“You’re an idiot”, Billy popped in, “Football is the name people who don’t know what football is call soccer.
The guy behind the counter stopped typing for a few moments, minutes, his face carefully neutral, then resumed, maybe typing a little more forceful than before. Not that this was noticed by the three young adults standing at the counter.
A few minutes and many mouse clicks later he looked back up. "Your plane left New York yesterday at 18:25"?
The three of you looked at each other. “It was a little before 7” You say, “I remember that much”.
“Let me check something”, the clerk said, calling up yet another menu on his terminal. “ Flight 847, Gate 12, scheduled to leave at 18:25, delayed, left New York at 18:47. Hmmm… “Also departing gate 13, Charter 212, scheduled to leave at 18:35, delayed. Departed 18:48. That’s interesting. I think I may have an idea where your luggage is”.

He slid his rolling chair over to a desk to dial a number.
“Good evening. This is the American Airlines Lost Luggage Desk over at Heathrow. Can I speak to your equipment manager”?
Apparently he was put right through, because a moment later he began speaking again, although all you could hear was his side of the conversation.

“Hey Charles, Victor here. Yeah, yeah, I know. Good to hear you too. You know how it is. Hey, congratulations on the Philadelphia Union friendly. Yeah, that’ll show those Yanks. Oh yeah. Actually, that’s the reason I’m a calling. Got a couple of them here. Looking for some lost bags. Well, seems they dressed them up in Crystal colours and now they can’t find them. Didn’t happen to get mixed in with your lot, did they? No, seriously. I highly doubt they play. Not from the looks of them, no. What? Really”! He turns towards you and gives you a ‘thumbs up’ while still talking. “Guess I saved you the price of a call or three now, didn’t I. Yeah, send them over. I’ll let the Yanks know”.

He turned back to the boys waiting at the counter. “Looks like your bags got mixed in with the luggage from the Crystal Palace. Charles was just about to start trying to figure out who’s they were. They will be here in about 90 minutes. You can wait or we could send them on to your hotel”.

info.brief_description: You were ready for the experience of a lifetime, until someone changed your plans
info.description:
In this story you have just graduated from high school and to celebrate the ending of this great chapter of your life you and your friends are going to spend the summer backpacking across Europe before you all go off to college.

Unfortunately there are a few people that don’t want you to go, and since you have been planning and dreaming of this trip for years it’s going to take a lot more than a simple “Please don’t go” to stop you. Until by some cosmic twist of fate they acquire the power to make you stay.

Now feel free to create your own characters, with their own reasons for not wanting you to go, and how they make you stay but I do have a few basic ideas for you to consider:
1. Your mom isn’t ready for you to leave home so she might consider using age regression to turn you back to a baby making you go through the humiliation of diapers, baby food, booster seats, baby clothes, and ext. Or a toddler or any age you can find inspiration to write about
2. Your sister may be jealous that you get to go and she doesn’t, so she may swap bodies with you and go in your place leaving you to deal with her female body for the summer.
3. Your girlfriend may simply be insane and decide to turn you into an object that she can keep with her all summer. Now this could be a piece of clothing, a doll, or anything you find amusing.

For now I’m not going to worry so much about rules but I do reserve the right to remove anything I believe to be inappropriate or just a pointless filler

Enjoy :)
